runs.comm: the first ball swings away, Jayawadene goes after it, and is beaten. To be fair to Jayawardene, the length was there to be driven
nearly played on! This one doesn't swing, and hence the inside edge from Jayawardene. Misses the stumps, though
more swing for Lee, a loose little poke by Dilshan. Beaten

Drama! Lovely bouncer, right at Dilshan's throat. He gets a a limp top edge, which falls towards square leg, within Lee's reach. Lee runs off for the catch, but collides with Jayawardene who is taking the single. No question of obstructing the field, though: Jayawardene didn't do it on purpose
slower ball, driven to mid-off
length ball on the pads, Jayawardene misses out on easy runs. Is hit on the pad
flighted delivery, driven wide of mid-off for one
premeditated sweep, from outside off, gets a single to short fine
another near played-on dismissal! Dilshan looks to cut this, but the ball hasn't turned enough, and the bottom edge bounces over the stumps
beautiful, beautiful shot, makes room, goes inside out, all along the ground, between cover and extra cover
this is like the lob winner in tennis, steps down the wicket, and chips it over mid-on, easy does it
looks for the back-cut, finds backward point
slower bouncer, nicely pulled away, keeps it down by rolling his wrists on it
Jayawardene is off to a quick start, this is just a touch too straight, and he muscles it wide of deep square leg
some premeditation here as he looks to make room. lee goes full and outside off. Jayawardene ends up swinging inside the line

this is top batting. A slower ball from Lee, Jayawardene pauses his shot for a second, then presses play once the ball arrives, cutting it between cover-point and backward point, who are within hand-shaking distance of each other
near yorker, on the pads, dug out for a single

Given out lbw! Lee is so convinced he doesn't even appeal until he has reached the stumps at the striker's end. This is a length ball, angling into the pads, Dilshan moves across, plays across the line, and misses. My initial reaction was that it might be going down, but I am neither the umpire nor the replay operator. Replay shows it pitched in front of middle, and hit Dilshan in front of leg, just outside the crease. Perhaps clipping leg then
good short delivery, Jayawardene looks to turn this to leg, gets a leading edge for a single
angled across Chandimal, who cuts without feet movement. Is beaten
length ball outside off, pushed to cover, Chandimal sends Jayawardene back. Good call
worked off the pads, gets a single wide of mid-on
Jayawardene goes after a widish delivery. No feet, and hence not close to the line. Beaten
back of a length, outside off, pushed to mid-off for a quick single. Johnson puts in a superb dive to back this wild throw up, from Warner at mid-off
plays the late-cut this time. Johnson at third man gets a bad bounce, but keeps them down to one
low full toss, gets a thick outside edge, towards third man
Clever cricket... slower bouncer, Jayawardene shapes up for the pull, then withdraws from it, and just as an afterthought, deflects this over the keeper's head. Can't set fields for these
poor delivery, and punished accordingly... full toss on the pads, with the fine leg up, flicked past that fielder
backs away to try to go over the covers, manages just a mis-hit to mid-off, but steals the single
Chandimal joins the party. Gets under a length ball and lofts it over mid-off - 15 off the over
Toying around with the bowlers here... Another length ball, outside off, and he drives it with an open face, deliberately over point
this is even better because this is along the ground, and pierces the five-men cover ring. Slightly slower delivery, waits for it, and cuts it in front of square, between cover and extra cover
sensational stuff, and yet not a hint of violence. Punches this on the up, and bisects cover and extra cover. Those five men can just stand and watch
angled wide outside off, Jayawardene misses the line this time. That's some respite for Australia
goes over the cover ring this time, one bounce to sweeper-cover
full and wide outside off, beats Chandimal's attempt to squirt it past point
and accordingly Jayawardene exploits the deep-set fields by playing softly, and wide of long-on for two
sharp turn this time, beats Jayawardene's attempt to run it down
the arm ball, played back to O'Keefe off the inside half of the bat
short and wide, cut away to sweeper-cover
drops this into the on side for a single
pushed into the on side for another single
short and wide, cut away into front of square. Gets just the single. Will think he has missed out on this gift
fuller legbreak, Chandimal looks to turn this to leg, ends up playing it back to the bowler
flatter, into the pads, punched away square, gets a couple for it
unfortunate for Australia. Chandimal skips out of the crease, doesn't quite get to the pitch, but the thick edge goes fine of short third man. No slip obviously
His tendency to play to leg has got him! For the second time in this over he tries to work a legbreak to from well outside off to the leg side. Gets a healthy leading edge that carries to Smith
full, outside off, clears the front leg, and muscles this to long-on for one
length ball, around off, played to straight extra cover
slower ball, hit on the up, powerful shot, towards long-on, where O'Keefe misfields and costs Australia three runs

nothing going Australia's way. This is a good bouncer, but the top edge clears the wicketkeeper who is running back. John Hastings, though, makes a good save running from fine leg to behind the keeper, and relays it to Watson
length ball, and Perera has hit the leather off this. Good job by Johnson to get a hand to it, but it still needs some chasing by O'Keefe from long-on, to keep them down to two
the short ball does the job for Johnson. This is just outside off, shoulder-high, and Perera upper-cuts this one straight down Watson's throat at third man
and the lady luck continues to tease Australia. This is a good offcutter outside off, gets a thick edge from Mahela, and beats third man who is pretty square. That's fifty for Mahela too
full, outside off, flicked into the on side
Huge huge appeal for lbw, this is the straighter one, and beats Mahela's attempt to work it to leg. Pitched in front of middle, hits him in front of middle and leg. Slightly unlucky to not get that
top shot again, moves across early, gets on a knee, and plays the regulation sweep in the air, and over the square leg fieldsman
plays the reverse paddle now, can't beat the short third man this time
overpitched, outside off, driven down to long-on
this would have been a big wide down the leg side had Jayawardene not worked it to short fine for one
short and gentle, worked wide of midwicket for two
wide down the leg side... no turn this time
inside edge onto the pad as he looks to force this to leg from outside off
turned away towards square leg for a single
swept away fine for a single
long hop, pulled powerfully, but can't beat deep midwicket
length ball on the pads, played back to the bowler
chips down the track and plays the chip shot towards deep midwicket
bee-you-tee-full shot... this is not driving length, and he just chips it non-violently over extra cover. the ball teases both long-off and sweeper-cover, and eludes both
clipped off the pads for one
gets a bottom edge on this sweep, which goes between his leg, and very fine on the leg side
the slog-sweep this time from Sanga, connected supremely for four, between deep midwicket and deep square leg
length ball, into the pads, misses out as he hits it straight to midwicket
late-cut for a single to third man
punched square for a single
short ball, Jayawardene looks to run this down fine, there is extra bounce that beats him
sees him give the charge, and bowls this short and into the body. They steal the leg-bye, though
back of a length, punched down to long-on for one - just the four of this over, one of them a leg-bye
Sangakkara! Charges at Smith, not quite to the pitch of the ball, but goes ahead with the slog sweep. Flat, flat six accrues
driven down and along the ground for a single to long-on
driven inside-out after making room, but can't beat extra cover
walks across the stumps to sweep this fine, but can't beat short fine leg
plays the inside-out chip over extra cover for a single
low full toss, it is mis-hit towards long-on, but doesn't carry to the fielder
Duke has got a wicket here. Just back of a length, Sanga manufactures the pull shot, hits it powerfully too, but straight to White at midwicket. The captain contributes
angled across him, Mendis plays an uncertain cut, is beaten
back of a length, around off, pushed back to the bowler - Duke's figures: 9 balls, 3 runs, 1 wicket
slogged this time, mis-hit towards long leg for one
Jayawardene walks right across the stumps, hit in front of the stumps, but this could just be going over the stumps. Leg-bye conceded

Super stuff from Hastings, this could be a big over in the final equation. This is pitched middle and leg, and headed to just outside off, Mendis tries the chop towards third man, gets the bottom edge onto the stumps. Duke: 12 balls, 4 runs, 2 wickets
punched down the ground for a single
played with an open face, but straight to point
pushed towards long-on for a single
slower ball, short outside off, beats Jayawardene's late-cut
bad bounce for Hastings at third man, but he cleanly takes the rebound off his chest and takes them down to one
Mathews checks in. Walks at Johnson, and smacks this over Jayawardene's head. Long-off has no chance to come around
cross-batted swipe from Mahela, but can't beat midwicket
well bowled, sees him coming, and goes short and into the body. All Mahela can manage is a bunt towards point for a single

I can tell you John Wayne Hastings is showing his worth here, with his third wicket in his third over. Mathews charges at him and makes room, but Hastings bowls one aimed at top of off, Mathews looks to open the face but is too late
picked off the legs for a single to fine leg
late-cuts this one to third man for one
Hastings bowls the bouncer, but it is well down the leg side
good short ball, just outside off, Perera looks to play the punch - too ambitious for a No. 8. Beaten
nicely placed between long-on and deep midwicket for two
leading edge from Mahela as he looks to turn this to leg, but it goes desperately wide of O'Keefe
Perera looks to send this out of Kandy, but hardly reaches long-on with a thick edge. Smith from long-on charges in and makes a dive to get his fingers under it
low full toss, pushed to deep midwicket for a single
turns this around the corner but can't beat short fine leg
pushed to cover for a single, another good over for Australia
Kula does his job by pushing this to long-on and bringing Jayawardene to the strike
slower bouncer, Jayawardene is beaten on the pull, expects a call for a wide, but it is called one for the over
the late-cut from Jayawardene, but just the single
short of a length, muscled down to long-on for a single
Jayawardene goes inside-out, drives towards sweeper-cover, Hussey does the fielding, and despite a bad bounce, keeps them down to two
this is bowled in ultra-slow motion, Jayawardene has to wait an eternity before driving it square for a single. Four over, three for 14 for the Duke

perhaps that's why I am not the captain.. this is a high full toss, Mahela opens the face on it, and hits it straight down short third man's throat. Mahela is in no hurry to walk off, he wants the height of this full toss checked. Replays suggest this is slightly higher than his waits, but his legs are bent a bit. And hang on. They have called this a no-ball. Come on umpires, give the bowlers some leeway
and here salt enters the wounds... length ball on the pads, and he has flicked it square for four
some luck finally for Australia. This is a length ball on the pads, the kind T20 batsmen hit for sixes blindfolded. Mahela, though, gets too much under it, and finds deep midwicket
gets the yorker right this time, Kula gets the single to bring the new man Herath on strike
full ball, hit hard into the ground, bounces over a leaping Lee for a single
Kula makes room to go over extra cover, Lee is full and straight, and hits the stumps. Australia's comeback continues, but have SL got enough already on this turning track?
what a horror ball... sees No. 11 shuffle across and bowls down the leg side, but well wide, and beats Haddin too - five wides
Mendis shuffles across again, ends up well wide of off even before the ball leaves Lee's hand. Lee bowls full and outside off, and bisects Mendis and the stumps!
